page.title: 18THE STUD FARM M HARRIS
page.content: The Combe Farm Stud was established 17 years ago and now comprises 6 stallions, 15 brodmares and their followers. The stud began with a nucleus of thoroughbreds until Arabians were introduced. Due to the financial climate in England the Arabians have taken priority. One of the largest economic factors in running a stud farm is the high labour intensity of looking after the animals and ever increasing feed costs make horse breeding in England a difficult proposition. The only viable course is to breed top class stock from internationally well known bloodlines to fill an export market. since its small beginnings the stud has achieved a level of success of National merit including having bred the thoroughbred Newmarket record breaking filly and Royal and National Arab show winners.
